column4: need help regarding twinview on nvidia (monitor and tv) problem: no colour on tv, reason: probably ntsc\pal settings, but i don't know how to set those up
yes, that is how i set up the picture, but it has no ntsc\pal settings, and i know that my tv has to be set to pal-g
some cards don't support pal, might need to confirm it does with the tech specs.
i had the same graphic card set up on windows xp before switching to ubuntu
ok, then try adding to your xorg.conf nvidia driver section: Option      "TVStandard" "PAL-G"
to what section precisely? i tried adding to a couple of them, and all i got is a blank tv and my own monitor switched to 640x480 and the os forgot i was using nvidia and switched to vesa
needs to go in the "Device" for your card.  Also note that max res using tvout will be 720x480.
max res on my monitor or on the tv?
on the TV, it's a limitation of the signal type.

i know that, it was the same on the pc. but the last time i was here i got the same advice to add that line to the Device section and everything kind of messed up... maybe it's the wrong section, i have a separate for the tv, as far as i understand xorg.conf
it was the same on Windows, i meant to say
there is no pal-g option. it never appeared, not even the ntsc line, nothing
and wherever i add it, things mess up
back up your file, then try adding it to the Device section (Videocard0), might also try adding Option "ConnectedMonitor" "TV"
check the nvidia readme for complete list of options.
